name: Orange and Anise Vegan Hojarascas
description: These vegan hojarascas, also known as polvorones, are scented with ground anise and orange zest, and dusted with cinnamon sugar.
recipeIngredient: 12 oz. (1 ½ cups)  Vegan butter, room temperature

recipeInstructions.text: Cream butter and sugar, in an electric mixer with the paddle attachment.
recipeInstructions.name: Cream butter and sugar, in an electric mixer with the paddle attachment.

recipeInstructions.text: Add vanilla, orange zest, and ground anise. Mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Add vanilla, orange zest, and ground anise. Mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Slowly add flour, with mixer at low speed. Mix until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Slowly add flour, with mixer at low speed. Mix until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Line 2 sheet-pans with parchment paper. Roll out dough on a floured surface to ¼ inch thick and cut into desired shapes (you can also roll dough into 1 inch balls and bake them that way).
recipeInstructions.name: Line 2 sheet-pans with parchment paper. Roll out dough on a floured surface to ¼ inch thick and cut into desired shapes (you can also roll dough into 1 inch balls and bake them that way).

recipeInstructions.text: Place cut dough on sheet-tray, 1 inch apart from each other.
recipeInstructions.name: Place cut dough on sheet-tray, 1 inch apart from each other.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 15 minutes or until bottoms become golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 15 minutes or until bottoms become golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven. As soon as they are cool enough to handle, dust with cinnamon sugar.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven. As soon as they are cool enough to handle, dust with cinnamon sugar.

recipeInstructions.text: Place on a wire rack to cool.
recipeInstructions.name: Place on a wire rack to cool.

keywords: anise hojarascas, orange hojarascas, vegan hojarascas
